data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: Well, speaking of natural disasters, they can occur at any time. Some disasters would give a warning, such as a storm preceding a flood. While others, such as earthquakes, give little or no warnings. Once a disaster happens, there is no time to prepare for it . Therefore, the best way for me to cope with a natural disaster is to prepare by having a plan before it strikes. It starts with identifying the types of disaster we are exposed to, whether it is from bushfires, floods, severe storms, droughts, cyclones or earthquakes, the likelihood of these occurring and their potential impact. After that, it is important for us to review our insurance policy and confirm we are covered against such events. Following a natural disaster, insurance companies can pay claims to policyholders with the right policies who are affected, allowing our homes and cities to rebuild. (146 字)
data.referenceText: What precaution should be required to reduce damage to homes and cities in natural disasters?
data.referenceTranslate: 在自然灾害中，应该采取哪些预防措施来减少对房屋和城市的破坏?
